message_1: A student has a sample of radioactive substance that has a half-life of 10 days. If the initial mass of the substance is 50 grams, what will be the mass of the substance after 30 days?
message_2:
To determine the mass of the substance after 30 days, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 50 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 50 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final mass = 50 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 50 * (1/8)

Final mass = 6.25 grams

After 30 days, the mass of the radioactive substance will be 6.25 grams.
